org.miloss.fgsms.common

Class AesCbcWithIntegrity.CipherTextIvMac

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.miloss.fgsms.common.AesCbcWithIntegrity.CipherTextIvMac
  • Enclosing class:
    AesCbcWithIntegrity

    public static class AesCbcWithIntegrity.CipherTextIvMac
extends Object
    Holder class that allows us to bundle ciphertext and IV together.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AesCbcWithIntegrity.CipherTextIvMac(byte[] c, byte[] i, byte[] h)
      Construct a new bundle of ciphertext and IV.
      AesCbcWithIntegrity.CipherTextIvMac(String base64IvAndCiphertext)
      Constructs a new bundle of ciphertext and IV from a string of the format base64(iv):base64(ciphertext).

        Construct a new bundle of ciphertext and IV.
        Parameters:
        c - The ciphertext
        i - The IV
        h - The mac

      • AesCbcWithIntegrity.CipherTextIvMac

        public AesCbcWithIntegrity.CipherTextIvMac(String base64IvAndCiphertext)
        Constructs a new bundle of ciphertext and IV from a string of the format base64(iv):base64(ciphertext).
        Parameters:
        base64IvAndCiphertext - A string of the format iv:ciphertext The IV and ciphertext must each be base64-encoded.

      • ivCipherConcat

        public static byte[] ivCipherConcat(byte[] iv,
                    byte[] cipherText)
        Concatinate the IV to the cipherText using array copy. This is used e.g. before computing mac.
        Parameters:
        iv - The IV to prepend
        cipherText - the cipherText to append
        Returns:
        iv:cipherText, a new byte array.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Encodes this ciphertext, IV, mac as a string.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        base64(iv) : base64(mac) : base64(ciphertext). The iv and mac go first because they're fixed length.
